fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend
Interface IncrementStrategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
OrderedIncrementStrategy, RandomIncrementStrategy
interface IncrementStrategy

This interface describes an increment strategy of an index provider. It implements a strategy design pattern, where the context is the index provider, and the target algorithm is the increment function. This class, invisible to the library user, is represented by an enum type in the Solution class.
This increment strategy defines the way to iterate on the reactives of a solution when processing to the research of reactives for a reaction rule. Basically, the two different strategies are ordered (first elements first), and random.
Other strategies could be implemented, as round robin.

This interface is used by the class IndexProvider, that passes its sub index provider to the function increment(SubIndexProviderSolution).

Author:
Andréolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur
See Also:
IndexProvider, SubIndexProviderSolution

Method Summary
 void increment(SubIndexProviderSolution sipSol)
          Increments the sub index provider's value by one.
 

Method Detail

increment

void increment(SubIndexProviderSolution sipSol)
               throws ChemicalException
Increments the sub index provider's value by one. This function is supposed to go on to the next combination of reactives of the specified SubIndexProviderSolution object.

Parameters:
sipSol - The sub index provider on a solution that has to be incremented.
Throws:
ChemicalException
